meanings.sent1: The ahistorical book only focused on the present.
meanings.sent2: Her ahistorical views made it hard for her to understand the significance of past events.
meanings.sent3: The ahistorical student thought the ancient ruins were just old rocks.
meanings.sent4: His ahistorical mindset kept him from appreciating the rich history of the city.
meanings.sent5: The ahistorical painting depicted a futuristic world with no ties to the past.

meanings.definition: Not concerned with or related to history.
meanings.sent1: The ahistorical debate centered on current issues rather than past events.
meanings.sent2: She had an ahistorical approach to politics, focusing only on the present policies.
meanings.sent3: The ahistorical museum exhibit featured modern art pieces with no historical references.
meanings.sent4: In his ahistorical speech, he ignored the lessons that history could teach us.
meanings.sent5: The ahistorical documentary explored futuristic technologies without mentioning past inventions.
